intro: Chrysocephalum apiculatum subsp. insigne, commonly known as the golden crownbelly, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a low-growing perennial shrub characterized by its bright yellow flowers and silver-blue foliage. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal and inland regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
